items.title: Committed to maintaining Fed independence, asserts Jerome Powell
items.summary: Jerome Powell, the Federal Reserve Chair, has strongly defended the central bank's independence. He emphasized that political interference could damage the Fed's credibility. Powell also indicated that an interest rate hike is not expected soon. Inflation remains above the target, driven by goods prices, while services sector disinflation continues. The Fed remains committed to serving the public interest.

items.title: US Fed Meeting: Jerome Powell-led FOMC keeps interest rates steady at 3.50-3.75% | 5 key highlights
items.summary: The Federal Reserve's FOMC decided to maintain key interest rates at 3.50% to 3.75% after three consecutive cuts. Chairman Powell noted core inflation is around 3%, with goods price increases attributed to tariffs, while job growth has slowed due to declining labour force participation.

items.title: US yields climb as Fed holds rates steady; flags sticky inflation, firmer labor market
items.summary: USA-BONDS/ (UPDATE 1):TREASURIES-US yields climb as Fed holds rates steady; flags sticky inflation, firmer labor market

items.title: US Fed meeting: FOMC holds rates steady. How can it impact the Indian stock market?
items.summary: The FOMC decided to keep the target range for the federal funds rate at 3.5% to 3.75%, its lowest level since 2022. Experts highlight a greater focus on US-India trade relations and corporate earnings as critical factors for market stability.&nbsp;

items.title: Amazon layoffs: Tech giant to offer most US-based employees 90 days to look for new role internally
items.summary: As Amazon moves to lay off 16,000 corporate employees, it has offered most US-based employees 90 days to look for new role internally. This decision contributes to a total of 30,000 job reductions in three months, as the company adapts to AI advancements and reduces management layers.

items.title: The new logic of the Chinese economy
items.summary: It provides new opportunities for China-India cooperation

items.title: India’s ageing crisis: Why elder care needs stronger regulation and national standards
items.summary: Senior care facilities operate under a patchwork of state laws—many adapted from hospital, mental health or social welfare frameworks not designed for long-term elder care.

items.title: Drug misuse: Govt may curb 'Pregabalin' sales
items.summary: The government is looking to control the sale of Pregabalin. This common medicine is being misused. The government wants to make sure it is only sold with a doctor's prescription. This move follows concerns raised by authorities. Pregabalin is used for pain and seizures. Stricter rules are being considered to prevent its misuse.

items.title: Fed Rate Decision: Status quo on policy as expected, pause follows 3 straight cuts
items.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell has announced the status quo on key US interest rates at the end of a scheduled review.

items.title: FMCG majors turn to bulk buying during harvest season to cut costs, curb commodity price volatility
items.summary: These companies are also shifting from all-year round buying and instead acquiring raw materials in bulk during harvest seasons to reduce costs. High prices of wheat, edible oil, sugar, pulses, and other agri-commodities had squeezed margins at these companies last fiscal year.

items.title: Baramati plane crash likely to result in ₹50 crore claim, insurers say
items.summary: A fatal Learjet 45 crash near Pune, killing five, is expected to trigger insurance claims of approximately ₹50 crore. The aircraft, insured by ICICI Lombard, was attempting to land when it crashed. This follows another aviation insurance claim of ₹18 crore earlier this month.

items.title: Celebrity endorsements fall 22% in 2025 as brands shift to influencers
items.summary: Celebrity brand endorsements saw a significant 22% decline in 2025, marking the steepest drop. Companies are shifting budgets from expensive celebrities to influencers, including nano-influencers, to connect with GenZ consumers and achieve better campaign measurement. While celebrities remain important in some categories, the trend favors community-focused advertising.

items.title: Private banks step up write-offs despite benign NPA ratios in December quarter
items.summary: Indian private banks increased loan write-offs by over 22% in the December quarter. This move aims to clean balance sheets. Despite low reported bad loan ratios, underlying stress persists, especially in retail and unsecured lending. Banks are proactively managing credit costs. This trend highlights ongoing asset quality pressures that observers are watching closely.

items.title: PNB Housing Finance bets on affordable loans, margin focus under new MD
items.summary: PNB Housing Finance aims to balance growth and margins under a new leader with a five-year tenure, following frequent leadership changes. The company is shifting focus to higher-yielding affordable and mid-market housing loans, targeting a 45-50% share by FY28. This strategy, coupled with funding new developers, seeks to improve profitability and address investor concerns.

items.title: Inox Clean Energy raises ₹3,400 crore from NaBFID to refinance Vibrant Energy debt
items.summary: INOX Clean Energy is securing a ₹3,400 crore, 20-year loan from NaBFID to refinance debt post-acquisition of Macquarie's Vibrant Energy. This loan, priced between 8-8.50%, will be secured by seven solar, wind, and hybrid projects with long-term PPAs. The move aims to retire expensive debt and reduce the company's equity component.

items.title: Amazon Still Doesn’t Understand Brick-and-Mortar Retail
items.summary: The day Amazon.com Inc. announced in June 2017 that it was acquiring Whole Foods for almost $14 billion, employees of the natural grocer packed into the company’s Austin headquarters to meet their new bosses.

items.title: Bharat Petroleum will invest ₹25,000 crore towards City Gas Distribution in next five years
items.summary: Speaking to reporters, BPCL’s Business Head for Gas Rahul Tandon added they have already spent ₹8,000 in their 26 operational geographies

items.title: Turkish products excluded from India, EU FTA benefits
items.summary: Under the EU-Turkey Customs Union, Turkiye has to match the EU's common external tariff. So, when the EU lowers its tariffs for an FTA partner such as India, Turkiye would have to extend the same benefit to India.

items.title: US Federal Reserve holds rates steady amid sticky inflation, resilient jobs market
items.summary: The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady, citing a tight labor market and inflation above its target.  This decision occurs amidst political pressure from US President Donald Trump and concerns over the Fed's independence.

items.title: Deccan Gold Mines may start drilling at critical mineral projects this quarter
items.summary: Deccan Gold Mines will begin drilling at its critical mineral projects in India and overseas this quarter. The company plans to establish small-scale processing facilities by mid-2027. DGM is exploring nickel, copper, and platinum group elements in Chhattisgarh. In Mozambique, focus will be on lithium, tantalum, and copper. A tungsten project in Spain is also advancing.

items.title: Deutsche Bank Deepens Emerging-Market Rebuild, Adds Two Traders
items.summary: Deutsche Bank AG is deepening its push into emerging-market credit, adding two executives in New York as part of an expansion that began last year and included the high-profile poaching of a star trader from a rival.

items.title: IEPFA plans faster payouts for low-value unclaimed shares, dividends
items.summary: Under the existing system, the authority then oversees claim settlements and verifications, with the relevant companies playing a key part in the stipulated processes. The proposed move aims to do away with further verification by the IEPFA in cases of low-value claims to ensure faster settlement, as per the draft rules firmed up by the authority.

items.title: Maruti Suzuki misses market estimates despite record quarterly sales
items.summary: Maruti Suzuki's third-quarter net profit rose 3.7 percent. This missed market expectations. Weak exports and a one-time provision impacted the results. However, the company achieved its best-ever quarterly net sales. Strong demand during the festive season and a GST reduction boosted sales. Domestic sales volume also reached a record high.

items.title: Budget 2026 wishlist: Manufacturing sector seeks tax relief, lower compliance costs
items.summary: Indian manufacturing CXOs prioritize tax relief and reduced compliance costs in the upcoming budget, with over half flagging it as a top concern. The survey also highlighted the need for demand-side support, faster approvals, and improved logistics, with MSMEs identified as requiring the most policy assistance.

items.title: IBC tweaks will align Indian laws with global regime: IBBI
items.summary: India's insolvency law is set for significant changes. These amendments aim to bring the system in line with global practices. The goal is to enhance the rescue of struggling companies. The Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India chairman highlighted these upcoming improvements.

items.title: ASML Investors Press Executives on Outlook Despite Bookings Beat
items.summary: ASML Holding NV failed to satisfy investors with record orders in the fourth quarter as analysts continued to question whether the Dutch semiconductor equipment maker can sustain its artificial intelligence-fueled momentum.

items.title: Micro lenders get Rs 8,000 crore credit guarantee boost amid funding stress
items.summary: This government backing aims to support the sector facing delinquencies and funding challenges. The scheme will incentivize banks to lend to microfinance institutions, especially smaller ones. It will be implemented outside the union budget framework and announced after Cabinet clearance.

items.title: Gold, Silver scale new peaks as dollar slips
items.summary: Gold and silver have hit record highs, fueled by strong demand and a dropped value of the US dollar. Escalating geopolitical tensions are also playing a significant role in this upward trend. Wealthy investors are turning to gold as a safe haven, while traders explore financing options for gold acquisitions.

items.title: Fertiliser imports rise as local production falls this fiscal year
items.summary: India significantly boosted fertilizer imports this fiscal year. Urea imports rose 85%, DAP 46%, and NPK 122%. This helped meet demand for key crop nutrition months. Urea sales increased despite lower domestic production. DAP sales saw a slight dip, but imports ensured availability. Complex fertilizer production grew, with imports more than doubling.

items.title: DERC norms: HC seeks Delhi government response on Tata Power plea
items.summary: Tata Power Delhi, a joint venture between the Delhi government and Tata Power Co., supplies electricity in Delhi's northern areas.

items.title: India, EU working to make FTA operational at earliest
items.summary: India and the European Union are pushing for an early operationalization of their free trade agreement. The deal, in the making for two decades, is expected to be in effect within a year. This agreement offers access to a massive EU market. India is actively engaging with EU stakeholders to expedite the process.

items.title: Global energy markets start 2026 with ample supply & stable prices: Dave Ernsberger, president of S&P Global Energy
items.summary: Global energy markets are starting 2026 with plentiful oil, gas, and renewable supplies. Prices are expected to remain stable, encouraging economic and demand growth. India is strategically discussing its energy mix. However, electricity transmission faces significant logistical hurdles due to rising power demand from data centers and AI infrastructure.

items.title: Centre mulls broader start-up definition to push AI, deep-tech innovation
items.summary: The objective is to push more companies towards research-led innovation and high-impact technologies, while ensuring that India’s start-up ecosystem is not limited to digital platforms and service-based models.

items.title: SBI Card Q3 PAT jumps 45% but misses Street estimates; NII meets mark—Catch key takeaways
items.summary: SBI Card has staged a mixed financial performance for the December quarter, with a better-than-expected net interest income (NII) but a weaker net profit.

items.title: Delhi High Court issues notice to DGCA on delay in pilot rest rules
items.summary: The temporary relaxation was provided only to IndiGo following an operational meltdown at India's largest airline last December. For long-haul and ultra long-haul flights of Air India, the extension will continue till March 31. Carriers are pushing for another extension as well.

items.title: India set to ink 10-yr uranium supply deal during Canadian PM Mark Carney's visit
items.summary: Canadian PM Mark Carney's upcoming India visit in March is poised to secure a significant 10-year uranium supply deal worth 2.8 billion Canadian dollars. The trip also aims to finalize agreements for long-term energy supplies, including crude oil, LPG, and LNG, as well as critical minerals, seeking to reset bilateral ties.

items.title: JSW Energy to set up its first nuclear power plant by 2030
items.summary: JSW Energy is set to build its first nuclear power plant by 2030. The company is exploring different reactor technologies, including large and small modular options.  A pilot plant will be constructed first to understand operations.  Site selection is also in progress.  JSW Energy aims for timely execution and cost control in this significant venture.

items.title: India, US closer to trade deal? Official sources say ‘very significant’ progress in negotiations
items.summary: India and the United States are reportedly closer to an upcoming trade deal as there is ‘very significant’ progress in negotiations between the two countries. This comes amid the final stages of a free trade deal with the European Union.&nbsp;

items.title: Canada offers reliable energy supply to India amid global shake-up
items.summary: Canada is positioning itself as a dependable energy partner for India. Canadian energy minister Tim Hodgson stated Canada can supply crude oil, LNG, and LPG at competitive prices. This move aims to diversify Canada's energy exports beyond the United States. Canada sees energy as a key to doubling trade with India by 2030.

items.title: ONGC and RIL agree to share resources
items.summary: State-run ONGC and Reliance Industries have agreed to share resources for upstream offshore operations in India's eastern offshore, including the Krishna Godavari basin and Andaman offshore. This collaboration aims to optimize costs, accelerate project execution, and enhance asset utilization in complex deepwater projects through shared infrastructure and services.

items.title: Jio-BP, Adani Total plan to co-locate fuel outlets hits regulatory hurdles
items.summary: Reliance BP Mobility and Adani Total Gas face regulatory challenges in their plan to co-locate petrol/diesel outlets with CNG stations. The companies are seeking policy support and rule realignment to enable this reciprocal infrastructure sharing, which is currently hindered by complex licensing and district magistrate clearances.

items.title: Going to aggressively pursue exploration in deepwater areas, says ONGC Exploration Director O.P. Sinha
items.summary: Mr. Sinha pointed out to policy support from the government and greater opportunities among the reasons for enhanced tilt to deepwater exploration

items.title: Dell, NxtGen to build India’s largest AI factory with over 4,000 NVIDIA Blackwell GPUs
items.summary: Dell Technologies is powering India's first and largest dedicated AI factory for NxtGen AI, featuring over 4,000 NVIDIA Blackwell GPUs. This initiative aims to significantly boost India's domestic AI computing capacity for enterprises, startups, and government programs. The deployment will support large-scale generative AI and high-performance computing workloads within NxtGen's sovereign cloud framework.

items.title: Vi lines up ₹45,000-crore capex over 3 years in turnaround bid
items.summary: Vodafone Idea is gearing up for a game-changing transformation with a whopping investment of ₹45,000 crore over the next three years. This major capital infusion is set to bolster network capabilities and spearhead the rollout of 5G services in crucial regions.

items.title: ATM withdrawals decline in 2025, bigger cash withdrawals signal shift in spending
items.summary: ATM cash withdrawals across India declined in 2025, even as the average amount withdrawn per transaction increased. The trend points to changing consumer behaviour, with fewer ATM visits but higher-value cash usage amid a growing digital payments ecosystem.

items.title: Trump Account for babies: JPMorgan, Bank of America to match $1,000 contributions for eligible employees — what we know
items.summary: JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America will match the US government's $1,000 Trump Account contributions for eligible employees. Details her

items.title: AYUSHEXCIL, Zepto sign MoU to improve access and quality assurance for Ayush products
items.summary: Union Ayush Minister, Prataprao Jadhav, stated that innovation-driven Indian startups are playing a critical role in improving last-mile access to trusted wellness products

items.title: Larsen & Toubro Ltd. Q3 net profit falls 4% to ₹3,215 crore
items.summary: During the quarter the company had one-time material provision of ₹ 1,191 crore towards employee benefits arising from the implementation of the new labour codes which has been classified under Exceptional Items

items.title: TVS Motors Q3 net doubles to ₹1,051.95 crore
items.summary: The company’s revenue from operations increased 33.7% to ₹14755 crore in the reporting quarter from ₹11,034.88 crore in the previous period

items.title: Adani Electricity Mumbai gets AAA rating, first private power distributor to match sovereign grade
items.summary: "The rating upgrade reflects strong regulatory support, improving credit metrics and sustained deleveraging, supported by stable cash flows under a cost-plus regulatory framework," India Ratings said in a statement

items.title: IndiGo CEO says 3 days of disruptions cannot define airline's 20 years
items.summary: IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers addressed recent flight disruptions. He acknowledged customers were let down for three days in early December. These disruptions led to flight cancellations and delays, impacting many passengers. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation imposed fines and directed systemic corrections. Elbers emphasized these few days do not represent IndiGo's 20-year journey.

items.title: ONGC eyes partnership with ExxonMobil to jointly bid for oil & gas blocks
items.summary: Upstream major ONGC will focus on exploration activities along the east coast, including the Mahanadi, Krishna-Godavari (KG) and Cauvery basins, and off the coast of the Andamans. It also struck a resource-sharing pact with RIL.

items.title: Our aim is to become a one-stop aviation shop: Jeet Adani
items.summary: The memorandum of understanding with Embraer is aimed at enabling the Adani Group to offer end-to-end aviation solutions.

items.title: L&T order inflows in Q3 surge to record  ₹1.36 trillion, top expectations
items.summary: While order inflows were on the upside, L&amp;T’s consolidated profit for the December quarter fell 4% y-o-y to  ₹3,215 crore, weighed down by a one-time provision of  ₹1,191 crore to comply with India’s new labour codes. Excluding that one-time provision, profit rose by a third y-o-y to  ₹4,406 crore.

items.title: India-US trade talks continue in cordial atmosphere: Official
items.summary: India and the US are engaged in highly cordial trade negotiations, with a US delegation visiting New Delhi for talks. Both nations are working to finalize the initial phase of a bilateral trade agreement. This visit follows the imposition of tariffs on Indian goods due to their purchase of Russian crude oil.

items.title: Why gold and silver are rallying sharply — Motilal Oswal explains what is driving the surge
items.summary: Gold and silver prices surged sharply as investors sought safety amid a weakening dollar, global bond market stress and rising geopolitical uncertainty, according to Motilal Oswal. With MCX gold and silver trading near record levels, analysts say the rush into precious metals reflects deeper concerns over monetary policy credibility and economic stability.

items.title: Dairy sector, sensitive farm products fully protected in India-EU FTA, says Commerce Dept
items.summary: Sensitive items such as dairy, cereals, tea, coffee, spices, pulses, poultry, soymeal and a variety of fruits and vegetables have been excluded from tariff reduction commitments in the India-EU FTA

items.title: India-EU FTA will have limited impact on Indian wine industry: Sula Vineyards
items.summary: India's largest wine company, Sula Vineyards, confirms the India-EU Free Trade Agreement protects local wine producers. A minimum import price of 2.5 euro per bottle is set. This framework balances domestic interests with market expansion. Gradual duty reductions for European wines are expected over 7-10 years, similar to the Australia deal.

items.title: Bharat Forge Ltd mourns the passing of Ajit Pawar
items.summary: Ajit Pawar made significant contributions to Maharashtra’s development, says Bharat Forge Chairman and MD Baba Kalyani

items.title: CSB Bank Q3 profit stays flat at Rs 153 crore amid higher slippages
items.summary: CSB Bank reported flat Q3 profit as higher provisions and sharp slippages offset strong loan and deposit growth. Shares fell sharply amid earnings disappointment and whistleblower allegations, even as management expressed confidence over asset quality and margin stability.

items.title: Cochin Shipyard Q3 Results: Cons PAT falls 18% YoY, revenue up 18%. Rs 3.50/share dividend announced
items.summary: Cochin Shipyard reported an 18% YoY decline in Q3 net profit, while revenue rose 18%. Sequential profit and revenue growth, an interim dividend, and global expansion through a JV and acquisition highlight strategic initiatives.

items.title: India to slash tariffs on high-end EU cars from 110% to 30% in boost for luxury carmakers
items.summary: India has significantly slashed import duties on high-end European cars to as low as 30% under a new trade deal with the EU. This move opens India's tightly controlled luxury car market to brands like BMW and Mercedes-Benz, with phased reductions also planned for electric vehicles.

items.title: Boeing to deliver two aircraft per month to Indian airlines
Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Thursday
items.summary: Indian markets rose on optimism from the India-EU free trade agreement and supportive global cues. Sensex and Nifty extended gains, led by metals, financials, and energy sectors, while broader market participation reflected strong investor confidence.

items.title: Winter storm to cause billions of dollars in insured losses, UBS estimates
items.summary: A major winter storm that hit the United States ‍in recent days is ​expected to cause billions of dollars in insured losses, ⁠analysts at brokerage UBS said in a note.

items.title: HAL aims to tap civilian market
Vodafone Idea to invest ₹45,000 crore over next 3 years, aims for double-digit revenue growth
items.summary: AGR relief. Vi plans big network upgrade, eyes SOHO and home broadband

items.title: Veranda Learning Solutions files scheme for commerce vertical demerger with NCLT
items.summary: Demerger to consolidate operations of Veranda’s brands including JK Shah Classes, BB Virtuals, Navkar Digital Institute, Tapasya College of Commerce and Logic School of Management, into a newly incorporated entity - JK Shah Commerce Education Limited

items.title: Chartered Speed, EKA Mobility to deploy 1,750 electric buses in Bengaluru
items.summary: Bengaluru has secured 1,750 electric buses for its public transport. Chartered Speed Limited and EKA Mobility will deploy these vehicles. This marks a significant step in enhancing sustainable public transport in the city. The deployment represents a substantial portion of Bengaluru's planned electric bus induction. The initiative aligns with India's clean mobility vision and decarbonisation goals.

items.title: Spritual-tech start-up Astrotalk’s net profit plunges by 62 per cent to ₹32.84 crore for FY25
items.summary: Astrotalk’s net profit drops despite increased revenue and user engagement in urban markets

items.title: Aircraft that carried Ajit Pawar holds ₹210 crore in liability insurance
items.summary: The aircraft of VSR aviation, solely insured by ICICI Lombard General Insurance, was valued at ₹50 crore

items.title: PM asks global investors to tap into India’s expanding aviation market
items.summary: Says India will have more than 400 airports by 2047 from the present 160 when it completes 100 years of Independence

items.title: S&P Global upgrades Biocon Biologics credit rating To 'BB+'
items.summary: Biocon Biologics has received a credit rating upgrade from S&P Global Ratings. The company's long-term issuer credit rating is now 'BB+' with a stable outlook. This upgrade follows Biocon's simplification of its capital structure and reduction of debt. New product launches and industry trends are expected to support Biocon's earnings growth in the coming years.

items.title: TVS Supply Chain arm acquires Swamy and Sons 3PL for Rs 88 crore
items.summary: The acquisition is aimed at enhancing TVS Supply Chain Solutions' operating footprint and execution capabilities in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, a senior company official said on Wednesday.

items.title: Lodha Developers Q3 net profit at Rs 960 crore, revenue at Rs 4,670 crore
items.summary: Lodha Developers reported robust Q3 results with net profit rising slightly and revenue up 14% year-on-year. Record pre-sales, expansion into new projects, and strategic balance sheet management strengthened growth and market presence.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025–26: Date, time, significance and what to expect ahead of Union Budget
items.summary: The Economic Survey serves as an annual review of the Indian economy which the Economic Division of the Department of Economic Affairs under the Ministry of Finance prepares.

items.title: India’s pulses imports likely to drop by 30% during FY26 to 5 million tonnes
items.summary: Higher carry forward stocks, weakening rupee influencing imports, says IPGA chairman Bimal Kothari

items.title: BASF plans to set up global digital hub in Hyderabad
items.summary: This initiative not only boosts innovation but also strengthens BASF’s long-standing roots in India

items.title: Satin Creditcare Q3 profit jumps fivefold to Rs 72 crore on lower provisions, growth
items.summary: Satin Creditcare Network posted a fivefold rise in Q3 net profit, driven by lower provisions, strong business growth, and disciplined lending, marking 18 consecutive profitable quarters despite sectoral challenges.

items.title: Government plans seasonally adjusted IIP for clearer data
items.summary: Currently, India does not publish official seasonally adjusted IIP data. Adopting such a measure would bring India in line with global best practices, as countries like the United States, China, France, United Kingdom, South Africa and members of the European Union regularly release seasonally adjusted IIP figures.

items.title: India’s urea imports top 8 million tonnes as domestic sales rise 4% in April-December ‘25
items.summary: Shipments into the country up 85% as domestic output slips 3%, says Fertiliser Association of India

items.title: Three days of disruption can’t define IndiGo’s two-decade record: CEO Pieter Elbers
items.summary: Elbers said IndiGo is on a journey to become one of the world’s largest airline

items.title: Craftsman Automation Q3 PAT up at ₹107 crore on surge in other income
items.summary: Revenue from operations up 31% year-on-year at ₹2,057 crore

items.title: BPCL in talks with global shipping lines to source LNG from upcoming bunkering facility
items.summary: The state-run firm is in talks with Danish shipping major Maersk, Italian major Mediterranean Shipping Company SA, and Germany's HAPAG-Lloyd to source crude oil from the planned LNG bunkering facility at Kerala's Vizhinjam port, Rahul Tandon, head of BPCL's gas business, told Mint.

items.title: India does a balancing act with no duty concessions for lower-priced wines in FTA with EU
items.summary: A dedicated India-EU working group on wines and spirits has also been formed to facilitate regulatory alignment and knowledge exchange.

items.title: Fed crisis tool could be weaponised, Harvard economist says
items.summary: A key tool ​used by the U.S. central bank to stabilise global financial markets in ⁠times of crisis could be weaponised by the Trump administration, Kenneth Rogoff, a former IMF chief economist said, when asked if that was a possibility.

items.title: Indian consumers express measured realism, expect further personal tax reforms ahead of Budget: Survey
items.summary: Key expectations include increasing the standard deduction from ₹75,000 to ₹1 lakh and enhanced Section 80 deductions & rebates on medical and health insurance, per the annual India Union Budget Survey released by Kantar

items.title: India secures tools to guard FTA gains against EU green measures
items.summary: Rapid response mechanism and non-violation complaints provision to help India address all future EU measures that impair market access, including CBAM expansion

items.title: Gold rates today: MCX gold rises  ₹7,200 per 10g, silver jumps  ₹26,800 per kg as US dollar hovers near four-year low
items.summary: Gold and silver prices surged on 28 January, driven by a drop in the US Dollar Index. February gold futures hit  ₹1,64,900, while silver March futures reached  ₹3,83,100, reflecting gains of 21% and 62%, respectively, this month amid low interest rate speculation.

items.title: Lodha Developers reports strong Q3 revenue, highest pre-sales
items.summary: Lodha Developers recorded its best-ever quarterly pre-sales or sales bookings of  ₹5,620 crore in the third quarter of 2025-26, up 25% from a year ago.

items.title: eClerx Services announces 1:1 bonus issue, reports 40% YoY Q3 PAT growth
items.summary: eClerx Services approved a 1:1 bonus share issue alongside robust Q3FY26 results. Net profit rose 40% year-on-year, while revenue grew strongly, supported by steady execution, higher USD revenues, and resilient operating performance despite marginal margin compression.

items.title: Shapewear start-ups stitch growth as younger consumers, investors warm up to category
items.summary: What started out as a product for older people has become a youth favourite, with a shift in conversation from hiding one’s body to accentuating it.

items.title: Sundram Fasteners Q3FY26 profit flat at ₹131 crore
items.summary: Domestic sales in the third quarter were up 18% at ₹995 crore

items.title: Cigarettes to get costlier, sales to drop? Here's what Crisil says
items.summary: India’s domestic cigarette industry is preparing for a slowdown in sales next year, as new tax rules come into effect from February 1.

items.title: Supreme Court rejects JioStar plea, allows CCI to probe alleged abuse of dominant position in Kerala cable TV market
items.summary: JioStar, which has over 34% TV network share, had challenged the high court’s decision upholding the CCI’s order to probe allegations of abuse of dominant position by the broadcaster against Asianet Digital Network (ADN). The Kerala High Court bench comprised Justices Sushrut Arvind Dharmadhikari and Syam Kumar VM.

items.title: Boeing: Indian, South Asian Airlines will need nearly 3,300 new airplanes by 2044
items.summary: Air travel in India and South Asia is set for significant growth. Passenger numbers are expected to increase by 7% each year for the next two decades. This surge will necessitate approximately 3,300 new aircraft by 2044. Airlines will focus on single-aisle jets for short and medium-haul routes.

items.title: S&P 500 hits 7,000-point record high, Dow Jones, Nasdaq open higher ahead of US Fed's policy outcome; Trump reacts
items.summary: S&amp;P 500 surged to over a 7,000-point record high on 28 January 2026, while the Dow Jones, Nasdaq Composite opened higher ahead of the US Federal Reserve's policy outcome. Here's what investors need to know about the market today.

items.title: Voice AI is the final frontier in a country like India: Nandan Nilekani
items.summary: India’s AI story now is about voice, which is a whole new frontier due to variations, dialects and code-switching between languages

items.summary: Strong performance by the cigarette and non-cigarette FMCG segments expected to drive growth

items.summary: According ‘pass-through’ status for AIFs will help its investors earn better return on their investment

items.title: US stocks rise ahead of Fed rate decision, Big Tech earnings
items.summary: The ‍S&P 500 ​opened at 7,000 ⁠mark on Wednesday, while the Nasdaq inched towards ‌a ‌record high, fueled by a ‌gain in chip stocks and as investors geared up for ​a Federal Reserve ​rate decision as ‌well ‍as a ‍slew of Big Tech earnings.

items.title: Easy Home Finance raises $30 million led by Investcorp
